paper_title.ja: 航空用距離測定装置のインテグリティ保証のためのマルチパス解析
paper_title.en: Multipath Analysis of Aircraft Distance Measuring Equipment for Integrity Assurance

description.ja: 航空機のナビゲーションにはGNSSが主に利用されているが，GNSS信号は微弱であり，脆弱性を有する．GNSSに障害が発生した際にも航空機の安全と効率を維持できるように代替測位システム（APNT）を構築することがICAO（国際民間航空機関）での課題となっている．そこで，現在配置・運用されている航空用距離測定装置（DME）を2局用いたDME/DME測位の機能・性能を向上させて短期的なAPNTとすることが検討されており，欧州で標準化が開始された．GNSSのみ航法装置として認められる経路にDME/DME測位を適用するためには新たにインテグリティの保証が必要となるが，山岳地形が多い日本国内では特にマルチパスによる誤差がインテグリティの脅威となる．現在運用中のDME/DMEのインテグリティ保証のためには，飛行検査において発生するマルチパス誤差を抽出し，その原因を特定するとともにインテグリティへのインパクトを評価することが有効である．そこで本論文では，シミュレーションによりマルチパス発生位置を推定する手法を提案し，更にその誤差量のインテグリティへのインパクトを定量的に評価する一連の手法を示す．
description.en: GNSS is widely used for aircraft navigation. However, GNSS is vulnerable because the signal power is very small. Backup positioning system called APNT (Alternate Positioning Navigation and timing) is required in case of GNSS signal losses in order to maintain aircraft safety and operation efficiency. APNT is one of the issues at ICAO (International Civil Aviation Bureau) Navigation System Panel. Therefore, it is considered to improve the function and performance of DME / DME positioning using two DMEs currently deployed and operated to make it a short-term APNT, and standardization has started in Europe. In order to apply DME / DME positioning to routes where only GNSS is permitted as a navigation system, integrity assurance is required for the DME ground stations. As for Japan, multipath error is one of the serious threats to integrity assurance because of the mountainous terrain. So, it is required to extract DME multipath errors from the flight inspection, clarify the multipath sources and evaluate the impact of the multipath to the integrity assurance for existing DME in operation. In this paper, the authors suggest the method to detect the position of the multipath and the procedures to evaluate impact of the multipath to integrity assurance.

paper_title.ja: GBAS(地上型衛星航法補強システム)の安全性要求に関する設計と検証
paper_title.en: A Design and Validation for Safety Requirements of Ground-Based Augmentation System (GBAS)

description.en:
Ground-based Augmentation System (GBAS) is a safety-critical satellite-based aircraft precision approach and landing system, and supports all phases of approach, departure, and surface operations. The ICAO Standards and Recommended Practices (SARPs) for GBAS provide the safety requirements, i.e. integrity, continuity, and availability, as well as the system accuracy. The ENRI GBAS ground prototype system (Category-I) was developed to realize the safety requirements through a safety design process based on the probabilistic safety assessment (PSA), and includes the integrity monitor algorithms (e.g. GPS satellite signal deformation, low power, code-carrier divergence, excessive clock acceleration, erroneous ephemeris broadcast, ionospheric delay) in the risk mitigation.

The purpose of this paper is to describe the summary of a safety design process including an example of integrity monitor algorithms, and a validation method for the safety assurance performed through the development of this system. This paper provides the worst-case simulation result of performance validation for the signal deformation monitor algorithm using the long-term real data which is collected by the prototype system installed at Kansai International Airport.

paper_title.ja: PPD(個人用保護デバイス)の地上型衛星航法補強システムへの影響
paper_title.en: Effects of Personal Privacy Device (PPD) on Ground-Based Augmentation System

description.ja: GBAS（地上型衛星航法補強システム）は，衛星航法による次世代の航空機着陸システムである．米ニューアーク空港において，PPDによるGBAS基準局受信機への干渉問題が報告された．本論文では，入手した10台のPPDのRF特性を測定し，GBAS基準局受信機への影響を調査するため，C/N<sub>0</sub>（平均）とCMC（搬送波位相と擬似距離の差分）（標準偏差）を計測した．GBASの設置基準を検討するため，実験結果からPPDとGBAS基準局の離隔距離を求めた．
description.en: Ground-based Augmentation System(GBAS) is a next generation safety-critical satellite-based aircraft precision approach and landing system. A case of RF interference to GBAS reference receivers by PPD in Newark Airport was reported. This paper survey the 10 available commercial PPD properties of the transmitted RF signal, and effects on the GBAS reference GPS receiver based on the test data. The test results present measurements of the average of receiver C/N<sub>0</sub>, and the standard deviation of code minus carrier. From the attenuator levels, the geographical separation for the PPD and the GBAS reference receivers was calculated. It is possible to contribute the development of GBAS siting criteria.

paper_title.ja: 地上型衛星航法補強システムのためのGPS衛星故障信号検出手法としきい値決定方法およびその評価
paper_title.en: Development of GPS Signal Quality Monitoring Technique and Determination Method of its Monitor Threshold for Ground Based Augmentation System, and their Evaluation

description.en:
An Aircraft landing system using Differential GPS (Global Positioning System), such as GBAS (Ground Based Augmentation System), requires high reliability and integrity. It is well known that a satellite failure like the case of 19th satellite problem in 1993 produces large positioning error on GBAS users. Therefore, it is necessary to detect such failures and to alert within the time of TTA (time-to-alert) in order to secure the integrity of GBAS.

This paper describes that the method of the GPS Satellite failure detection in the SQM (Signal Quality Monitor) which we propose to use for GBAS. We also refer to how to determine a threshold and MDE (Minimum Detectable Error) by false detection probability and miss detection probability based on the result of a hardware simulation. Finally, we apply the method to the real signal. As results, it is successfully demonstrated that the MDE calculated by the proposal technique satisfies the acceptable value of the pseudo-range error of a ranging source monitor demanded by the high category GBAS examined now.

paper_title.ja: 航空機からのGPS掩蔽(えんぺい)観測による大気屈折率計測—観測・計測・探査における電波応用の最新技術論文特集
paper_title.en: Airborne GPS down-looking occultation experiments

description.en: The development of airborne GPS down-looking occultation that provides tropospheric water vapor profile below the mountain top altitude, is presented. To accomplish GPS down-looking occultation experiment, an equipment was developed that consisted of two main elements. The first one was a DL receiver, designed for continuous tracking of occultation GPS satellite, so that lower bound of resulting water vapor profile can be expanded to ground. The second one was GPS/INS hybrid positioning system to estimate accurate velocity of the side antenna motion with an accuracy of several mm/s. GPS receivers are expected to contribute improvements in future forecasting purposes.

paper_title.ja: 地上補強型衛星航法システムのVHF補強情報伝送試験
paper_title.en: Flight Test of VHF Data Broadcast System of Ground Based Augmentation System

description.en:
We have been developing and evaluating GBAS (Ground Based Augmentation System), which includes VDB (VHF Data Broadcast) system. The VDB system with horizontal polarization generally has a null problem. Therefore we made a stacked array antenna known for a solution of the null problem and installed it at Sendai airport. We conducted flight tests and executed two types of flight procedure. One is a level flight including orbit and arc flight patterns for checking a coverage of VDB, and the other is an approach flight for checking occurence of message error on approach course. The results of flight to check the null problem showed deep nulls were reduced by the stacked array antenna and no message errors were detected in GBAS service area. And the results of approach flight showed message error rate was less than 10<sup>-3</sup>.

This paper introduces our GBAS equipments and the flight test results about it.
